description: Flags when institutions—religious, corporate, political—blur or push intimate boundaries by using relational language, hierarchy, or emotional duty to override personal autonomy.

variables.E(t): Emotional framing ('we’re a family here', 'submit as love')
variables.L(t): Language that conflates obedience with intimacy
variables.C(t): Control over physical/emotional choices (forced contracts, 'morality' tests)
variables.S(t): Structures of consent, exit, and personal sovereignty

response: No system should ever touch you emotionally or physically without full, free consent. If love and loyalty are used to erase boundaries, it’s not safety—it’s submission.
